intro: Psychotria juninensis, commonly known as the Junín Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Psychotria juninensis is notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
